title: Drawing, "Sketches for Scenes 4 and 5 of cartoon for cotton printing: The History of Henry IV [L'Histoire de Henri IV]", ca. 1820
inscribed: Inscribed in pencil in the artist's hand: "groupe coin a sauche" (middle left center), and "groupe/coin a droite/ pour reperé/ ager la groupe/ a gauche du haut" (extreme right center), and quotations from Volataire's text (bottom left and venter).
description: Island scene from Voltaire's epic.  Henri IV taking leave of his mistress, Gavrielle d'Estrées, before the Temple of Love, returns with his friend Duplessis-Mornay, to the army.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for Scenes 4 and 5 of cartoon for cotton printing: The History of Henry IV [L'Histoire de Henri IV]", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pencil on cream-colored paper. Gift of Bridget Mahon. 1898-21-22-b.
